stories.text:
Hello HN,

I’m stuck in between choosing roles and having a hard time in figuring out where should I specialized

Long story short what other roles can I pursue besides web development
stories.title: Ask HN: What roles can you pursue besides web development?
Remote-first work is taking over the rich world

stories.text:
Hi HN Community,

I've been working on this startup [https://unfake.carrd.co] where we are helping footwear brands fight counterfeits effectively. We are doing so using the power of NFC tags combined with the uniqueness of NFTs.

I've made a prototype. You can check it out on the website mentioned above or here: https://youtu.be/fHCxnHlQIjk

I would like to know the best possible way of reaching out to big footwear brands for demonstrating them the concept in order to tie-up with them.

Let me know if you have any other suggestions/feedback as well.

Peace Hammad Nasir
stories.title: Ask HN: How to reach out to big footwear brands in order to tie-up with them?
Drive ROS robots from the browser with teleop-xyz

stories.text:
Hello, I'm Aaron.

I hold a BS in ChemE, but my day-job is teaching English in China - I think I do a good job. Also I write fiction at my website.

For several years, I've made little projects on the web, mostly in PHP and JavaScript, for example: a game where people "invest" in subreddits like stocks [1], a reddit-like-commenting system [2], my own website [3], etc.

How could I transition to a remote web-developer job most effectively?

Coding boot-camp? Crank through job-boards and applications? Go through an online MS in CS?

My coding is not strong, but I can get stuff to work in PHP and JavaScript, and I can use web APIs fairly well. I'm lacking in skill and knowledge, but I hope to remedy that.

So, if you have a suggestion for how I might most effectively improve and hopefully even be remunerated, I'd be grateful to hear your thoughts. Thank you.

[1] paaronmitchell.com/karmakarma [2] github.com/aaron5m/rlc [3] paaronmitchell.com
stories.title: How can an English teacher transition into web-development?
What we're getting wrong about the 'Great Resignation'
